snippet: Businesses like restaurants and hotels that rely heavily on low-income workers are trying to decide how to change their business models for the new health care law.
abstract: Smaller businesses like restaurants and hotels that rely heavily on low-income workers are trying to decide how to change their business models for the new federal health care law; health care experts say much confusion exists over what is highly complicated law.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and STEVEN GREENHOUSE

lead_paragraph: Businesses like restaurants and hotels that rely heavily on low-income workers are trying to decide how to change their business models for the new health care law.

headline.seo: Small Employers Weigh Impact of Providing Health Insurance
headline.main: Small Employers Weigh Impact of Providing Health Insurance

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
